title: Unable to connect to login queue
body:
AHHHHHHHHHHHH.......HELP I JUST WANT TO PLAY LEAGUE!! 
With the new patch, my client is stuck at "authenticating" and I can't log in because it's "unable to connect to login queue". I checked my firewall, my antivirus, and even ran it with administer but still no luck. Are the servers having problems or anything because it says everything is running fine. This is also occurring to my friend as well.

replies.body:
I also had the error: "LoL new Client unable to connect to the login queue". Even though i thought i did everything good and it was a Riot server issue it wasnt.
Allready tried all Riot's solutions and they did'n work. After some debugging i did finaly resolved the problem myself..

The problem was with a configuration setting in the Esset Security Software. And it was a setting that did'n deactivate even while u fully disable the software (like temp. disable firewall).

In the Esset software you can enable Protocol Protection in the Advanced Settings menu. From then on the software starts controlling all SSL and TLS configuration's and every certificate that comes with it.

I came to this while reading the Log: 2017-05-21T13-09-01_1968_LeagueClient.log
I has the following line:
000012.699| ERROR| lol-login| ALE-4C0F8C92 - FAILED_TO_COMMUNICATE_WITH_LOGIN_QUEUE - Plugin "rcp-be-lol-login" couldn't talk to "https://lqak.euw1.lol.riotgames.com/login-queue/rest/queues/lol/authenticate" because: 60 - "Peer certificate cannot be authenticated with given CA certificates".

This got me thinking that i let Certificates be mastered by the Esset Security software and not by Microsoft. And thus i started searching in the menu and found that i could deactivate that option. It's called Protocol Filtering and SSL/TLS-Protocol Filtering. Once i deactivated both of these settings. The issue was gone.

So this got me thinking, because at some point this did work. Even with the new client. Did something in security changed on the client? Remember the old client did work, new did 2 but after a certain change it didn. So i think Riot's higher level of security also needs attention in 3rd Security Software. 

Hope this resolution can also help others with same kinda problems.
Is this still an issue for you?  It seems that some ISPs were having some issues which resulted in failing to authenticate.  Let me know!

I am still having the issue with logging in. I have reinstalled League 4 times, I have checked my firewall, done all of the steps in your guide to fix it like the DNS and things like that, I have forced a re-patch and even tried the guide by Elma Jouii and tried to forward the connections to the servers manually and still nothing. It had been down for about 3 days and I am very very confused, any help at all would be appreciated
Nope it should be good now. Thanks!

Hi there! 
If you could take a moment to read my comment on this post 
> https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/m02U46pw-stuck-authenticating-5112017 
I could hopefully help you solve this!
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
